subject: Trouble using PrivateAccessor
msgSnippet: I have a private method that I d like to test.  The private method is below: _____________________________________________________________________ private
messageBody:
I have a private method that I'd like to test. The private method is
below:
_____________________________________________________________________
private static PrintService getPrinter(DocFlavor flavor,
PrintRequestAttributeSet aset) {
PrintService[] pservices =
PrintServiceLookup.lookupPrintServices(flavor, aset);
if (pservices.length > 0) {
return pservices[0];
}
else return null;
}
_____________________________________________________________________

the code to test this method is:
_____________________________________________________________________
public void testGetPrinter() {
Class[] argTypes = new Class[]{(Class)flavor.getClass(),
(Class)aset.getClass()};
Object[] args = new Object[]{(Object)flavor, (Object)aset};
Object obj = null;
try {
obj =
PrivateAccessor.invoke((Class)simplePrinter.getClass(), "getPrinter",
argTypes, args);
} catch (Throwable t) {
t.printStackTrace();
}
PrintService printService = (PrintService) obj;
System.out.println("printService: " + printService.toString());
assertTrue(printService != null);
}
____________________________________________________________________
When I run my tests i get the following exception:
____________________________________________________________________
/tools/jdk-1.5.0_04/usr/jdk/jdk1.5.0_04/bin/java -cp
/tools/junit/junit.jar:classes:lib/junit-addons-1.4.jar edu.umb.cs410.hot\
el.junit.AllTests
.java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: Failed static method invocation:
SimplePrinter.getPrinter()
____________________________________________________________________
I've been working on this all day, have tried 3 different jdk's (1.3,
1.4 and 1.5) all to no avail. I suspect that I'm missing something
really obvious. Can anyone point me in the right direction?

Thanks,
Claude
